thread.title: Canterbury soccer girls returning to state: three other local teams fall short
thread.title_full: Canterbury soccer girls returning to state: three other local teams fall short

title: Canterbury soccer girls returning to state: three other local teams fall short
text:
Canterbury soccer girls returning to state: three other local teams fall short 
By Dean Pantazi - 21 Alive October 24, 2015 Updated Oct 24, 2015 at 11:45 PM EDT 
UNDATED (21 Alive) - Canterbury's girls won their way back to the 1A girls soccer state finals to defend their state title on Saturday, but three other area teams came up short in semi-state play. 
The fourth ranked Lady Cavs drilled Faith Christian 7-1 in the semifinals of the Laville 1A semi-state, then took out fifth ranked Mishawaka Marian 3-0 in the final at night. 
It won Canterbury a rematch against Evansville Mater Dei in Indianapolis this coming Saturday. 
The Lady Cavs won last year's meeting 1-0. 
Blackhawk Christian's boys rallied for a 5-4 win in the semifinals of the 1A Argos semi-state, but then lost in the final to second ranked Mishawaka Marian 5-0. 
Canterbury's boys were eliminated by Penn 5-1 in the semifinals of the 2A Warsaw semi-state, and Leo's girls fell 2-0 to Penn in the semifinals of the South Bend St. Joe semi-state. 
For highlights of the days semi-state action click on the video icon on the screen above.
